DOC.brief_summary: Comparing the physical and sonographic findings of dancers with Chondromalacia patella to non-dancers athletes.
DOC.brief_title: Prevalence of Chondromalacia Patella Among Adolescent Dancers - Correlation Between Symptoms and Sonography Findings
DOC.detailed_description: A cross sectional study in which comparing of dancers to non-dancers athletes will be carried. Specifically, chondromalacia patella will be studied and compared between dancers with and without knee injuries and non-dancers athletes. Study will include detailed function and pain questionnaires, physical findings and sonographic study of the knee joint.
DOC.criteria: Group A Dancers with knee injury: 1. Min. 3 hours of classic ballet dancing per week 2. At least 4 years of dancing practice 3. Reported knee pain during the last 6 months 1. Injury other than knee joint Group B Dancers without knee injury: 1. Min. 3 hours of classic ballet dancing per week 2. At least 4 years of dancing practice 3. Reported no musculoskeletal injury during the last 6 months 1. None Group C Nondancers athletes: 1. Main physical activity is other than dancing 1. Reported no musculoskeletal injury during the last 6 months
